page.title: 04METHODIST CHAPEL
page.content: In Thorpe-on-the-Hill there is a methodist chapel,named after{John Hunt who was a missionary in Fiji.He was born in Newark in 1812 and he died in Fiji in 1848. The first chapel was previously a tractor shed.{The John Hunt Memorial {Wesleyan chapel,}built in 1909,is used for family services,Holy Communion, parade services,Sunday school and youth services. The Chapel has three alters and two aisles.There is also a hall used for coffee mornings and other such functions. A church magazine is published containing information about church events and services. The chapel is one of the most outstanding buildings in the village.
